campaign.story:
Flipper Zero is a portable multi-tool for pentesters and hardware geeks in a toy-like body. It loves to explore the digital world around: radio protocols, access control systems, hardware, and more. The main idea behind the Flipper Zero is to combine all the research & penetration hardware tools that you could need on the go in a single case. Out of the box, Flipper is filled with features and skills, but also It's open-source and customizable, so you can extend its functionality in whatever way you like, along with the community.
Flipper is made by makers who got tired of all these rough PCBs and bulky external modules. We want to make a versatile and beautiful platform for prototyping, hardware research, and pentest of any kind.    
Hardware with personality
Flipper Zero is an electronic tool that has a curious character of a cyber dolphin who really loves to hack. The dolphin grows while you interact with digital systems in real life and he does it in his very own manner. Your actions will build his personality and he will always have fun and comment on them in his unique style.
Flipper was inspired by the pwnagotchi project. However, unlike all the other DIY boards for hackers, it's designed with the convenience of everyday usage in mind. Flipper has a robust case, handy buttons and shape, and none of these dirty PCBs and scratchy pins. Flipper turns pentesting into a game, reminding you that researching always should be fun.
But don’t relax — If you become flabby and lazy, Flipper will let you know. And oh boy, you better do not piss him off, as this cyber dolphinius will not stop until you please all of his hacking needs so keeping Flipper happy is a great challenge. However, despite his rough character, Flipper knows that the main goal in life is having fun and he will be your loyal partner in everyday hacking on the go.  
Flipper becomes mad if you're lazy or ignore him
Technical Specification 
Flipper Zero is completely autonomous — it has a beefy battery, a handy 5-position directional pad, and a display. All the main functions and scripts are available from Flipper's menu, no computer or smartphone required. 
For more control, Flipper is equipped with the USB Type-C port for upgrading the firmware, deploying virtual serial port, and emulating HID input device. We have also decided to build in a cool old-school LCD screen, and not fancy TFT / IPS / OLED because it's perfectly visible in sunlight and has an ultra-low 400nA power consumption with the backlight turned off. This allows Flipper Zero to be always on and ready with more than 7 days of battery life.
To communicate with the real world systems, Flipper Zero has a built-in radio module based on TI CC1101 chip. It supports both transmitting and receiving digital signals within the 300-928 MHz frequency range. This is the operating range for a wide class of devices and access control systems such as garage doors remotes, boom barriers, IoT sensors, and remote keyless systems.  
Built-in radio module supports the most common IoT frequencies. Flipper also uses 433 MHz to communicate with other Flippers out there so you can make some cyber dolphin friends :)
Out of the box, Flipper Zero can emulate remotes for popular garage doors and barriers. You can keep hundreds of remotes in Flipper's memory as well as create a blank remote for the new wireless gate. Just select the right brand of the system in the Flipper menu, register a new key in your garage/barrier receiver, and give it a unique name for easy navigation between your remotes. 
As all the wireless protocols are software-defined in Flipper's open-source firmware, new ones will be added by developers in future updates. Out of the box, Flipper Zero will support PT-2240 and РТ-2262 protocols (brands DoorHan, Came, Nice, GSN, AN-Motors and more)
Customizable radio platform
CC1101 is well known universal transceiver designed for low-power wireless applications. And with a ready-to-use open-source library, developers can interact with the radio subsystem without limitations. You can write any wireless application, like custom protocol or decoder, as well as use it for connecting with IoT devices and access systems.
Signal Analyzer
Flipper Zero has an integrated decoder for popular remote control algorithms such as Keeloq and others, so you can analyze an unknown radio system to figure out the protocol under the hood.
Furthermore, Flipper can record the samples of radio signals to analyze it later with more sophisticated tools on the computer, as well as replay the saved samples. Many remotes and IoT devices such as doorbells, sensors, and radio sockets don't use any encryption at all — in this case, Flipper can replay the signal, even if the protocol wasn't recognized.
Low-frequency proximity cards are widely used in access control systems around the world. It's pretty dumb, keeps only a short few-byte ID, and has no authentication mechanism, allowing it to be easily read, cloned, and emulated by anyone. A 125 kHz antenna is located on the bottom of Flipper's body — it can read the EM-4100 and HID Prox cards, save them to the memory and emulate any of the saved cards by choosing one from the menu. 
Read, write and emulate 125kHz RFID cards
You can also emulate the card by entering its ID manually, so you can easily send it to your friend in a text format. Thus, Flipper owners can exchange card dumps with each other remotely without ever touching a physical card.    
Store hundreds of card IDs in memory and emulate them when you need to
iButton contact keys
Flipper Zero has a built-in 1-Wire pad to read iButton (DS1990A) keys, also known as TouchMemory or Dallas keys. This technology is quite old but still widely used around the world. It's based on 1-Wire protocol and doesn't have any authentication, so Flipper can easily read these keys, save IDs into the memory, write IDs to blank keys, and emulate the key itself.
Read, write and emulate 1-Wire keys (Dallas Touch Memory)
Flipper Zero has a unique contact pad design on the case edge — its shape works as a reader and simulator at the same time. The central pad of the iButton key is a data contact and the outer ring is a ground contact, so you need to lay the key in the correct position. The same contact pad can be used to simulate keys from the memory — just place Flipper to the system reader. This mode is also handy for silent interception of the 1-Wire data line.
Flipper Zero can act as a fully functional U2F key, that works with any U2F-enabled services such as Google, Twitter, Facebook, Dropbox, LastPass, Amazon AWS, and many others.
Universal 2nd Factor (U2F) protocol is an open standard for hardware security tokens used for secure authentication. Developed by Google, Yubico, and NXP, U2F acts as a universal key that is designed to add another layer to the traditional login+password authentication method. 
Even if your password gets compromised, an attacker will not be able to log in to your account. This method is much stronger than the usual SMS 2nd-factor method, as it doesn’t involve any third-parties like a cell phone operator. 
The infrared transmitter can send any signal to control electronics such as TV, air conditioners, stereo systems, and others.
Built-in infrared eye emulates any infrared remote
 Flipper contains a built-in library of common remote commands like switching on/off, changing volume or adjusting temperature, and so on. This library is constantly updated by Flipper community users that upload new signals to Flipper's IR remote database.
Infrared learning feature
At the same time, the IR receiver can catch signals and save them to the memory, so you can store any of your personal remotes and transmit it later, as well as upload it to the public database to share with other Flipper users. 
Catch and save new infrared signals in memory
Flipper's infrared eye can automatically detect baud rate, frequency, and modulation of the IR signals it captures without any configuration. That allows you to easily capture and store signals from all your remotes and other IR appliances.
Flippers firmware is completely open-source. You will be able to find it on Github once the first units are shipped. This means anyone can extend Flipper Zero functionality by modifying the code and writing your own plugins.
One-click environment deployment for VSCode and Arduino IDE
All built-in hardware can be used in your programs, such as a built-in display to print text and draw images, buttons to navigate, radio module for Sub-1Ghz communication, RFID for proximity cards, IR for infrared applications, and GPIO for extending the functionality with your own modules. And thanks to handy and fully documented libraries, accessing all of those is fast and easy.
SDK packages for all platforms
Ready-to-use development environment for all platforms
Deploying a development environment for STM32 can be challenging. Therefore, to simplify this process, we will supply ready-to-use packages for Arduino and PlatformIO+VSCode IDEs, available for all platforms, no drivers required. Just install the package and you are ready to go. Uploading sketches is as easy as on the regular Arduino board.
Extend with your own plugins
Flipper Zero can run your code as a separate plugin without losing its own firmware, unlike other basic Arduino boards. Thus, you can run any specific code from the plugins menu without uploading it every time you need it. And don't be afraid to break something — you can always reboot to original firmware if your code freezes.
Run your own programs from the plugins menu
Flipper Zero can be used as a versatile tool for hardware hacking. Its 12 built-in GPIO pins are 5V tolerant and allow you to connect it to any piece of hardware while running your own code, controlling it with buttons and printing debug messages to the LCD display. 
You can use it as a handy firmware flashing, debugging, and fuzzing device, as well as USB to UART/SPI/I2C/etc adapter connected to the PC. 
Extend with hardware modules
With the familiar header pins, Flipper allows third-party developers and makers to create their own compatible modules. Modules can be used to add new hardware features, interfaces, sensors, interface converters, wireless modules, and even a cellular modem.  We will share the mockup 3D model, so anyone can easily develop a mechanical design for their modules.
Extend Flipper with hardware modules
As we all know, computers completely trust connected input devices like mouse and keyboard. Flipper Zero can emulate a USB slave device, allowing it to be recognized by the computer as a regular input device, such as HID keyboard or Ethernet adapter, just as USB Rubber Ducky. You can write your own keyboard payloads to type any key sequence, as well as fuzzing USB stack on a target device.
Virtual HID keyboard injects keystrokes on a target PC
We realized long ago that 1 MB of STM32 flash is great to fit a firmware and all your plugins but might run out when it comes to additional data. There are lots of heavy data Flipper has to store: remotes codes, signal databases, dictionaries, image assets, logs and more. MicroSD slot always has been an obvious solution but we were not completely sure about the mechanics, so we didn't announce this before.
Today we can finally confirm: every Flipper Zero will have a MicroSD slot.
The slot will be push-push, so the card will be reliably secured inside and will not protrude. Flipper Zero can work without a MicroSD card so it's not included. You can put any FAT32 formatted card in and store all the needed assets with no worrying that the memory will run out.
Since Flipper Zero is a very resource-intensive project, not only from the hardware side, but also from the firmware side, we have identified some milestone features that we really want to implement, but can do it only if we have enough funding. These features get unlocked once the total pledged amount exceeds its respective goal.
More colors 
Flipper in a different case and display colors. Cool, huh?
Case and display color options

Bluetooth module 
Bluetooth module will allow you to interact with Flipper using your smartphone, as well as transfer interfaces like UART and SPI to your computer wirelessly. $300k and we are on the job.
Flipper will be able to exchange data with smartphone and computer wirelessly
NFC module 
Well, this is a big one. In the current version, Flipper is only capable of RFID at 125khz. The NFC standard (ISO-14443) operates at 13.56MHz. Adding this feature will require significant hardware changes and matching the two antennas on the same plane. If this gets unlocked, we are going to use the TI TRF7970A chip, the same chip as used in the HydraNFC project.

3D-printed prototypes
"Flipper Zero is a very personal project for me. This is the tool I've always lacked. As a maker, I constantly have to build my own DIY tools. Usually, it's a bunch of rough PCBs with mess of wires on a breadboard. Here is my first attempt to build a beautiful DIY tool: Epoxy NFC Reader.
Then, I tried to modify the original Tamagotchi with the RFID tag. I was inspired by Natalie Silvanovich's work on Tamagotchi modifications, Samy Kamkar's project  OpenSesame, HydraNFC, Proxamrk3 community, and personally thanks to Iceman. The last push for me was when I discovered the pwnagotchi project. At that moment I understood how my dream tool should look like. Feel free to contact me on Twitter."
 "This is the first project where I was in the role of the Art Director. My goal was to create a character with a cute personality and cool, cybernetic appearance, that would have a little perky look. If you like how Flipper looks (and behaves), feel free to check out my portfolio and follow me on Twitter."
"At Design Heroes we designed, engineered, and manufactured more than 50 hardware products, but Flipper Zero was an especially challenging one. This time I worked tightly with Pavel from the very beginning of the project, covering all the stages from legal issues to marketing. 
This is a new experience for me, and I’m very excited and proud of what we have achieved so far. Feel free to drop me a line on business inquiries."
"I believe in open-source and I like that Flipper's firmware is open so the community can contribute to it. Flipper Zero is a very unique combination of a hardcore professional tool for hackers and a fun gadget for newbies who just started learning electronics. Check out my homepage and subscribe on Twitter"
 "My approach was to make Flipper feel like a professional hacking tool, a functional device with a modern industrial look that catches one’s attention. Pavel wanted it to look futuristic and retro at the same time. I was inspired by cyberpunk medical equipment. Here is my portfolio."
"As a head of Mechanical Engineering, I am well experienced in designing products for mass production. I am responsible for ensuring that Flipper Zero is durable, long-lasting, easy to assemble & manufacture, as well as easy to maintain."

Shipping 
Flipper will be shipped worldwide.
Shipping will be charged via our pledge manager after the campaign, where you will also be able to confirm your rewards, address, and choose any add-ons. Please note, that our prices do not include local taxes, duties, and VAT, that will be subject to the laws and regulations of each individual country.
Press Kit
Press release, pictures, videos, and GIFs for press and blog articles. Link to Google Drive.
FAQ
Thank you for all your questions and comments! We'll try to answer the most important ones here:
What is the shipping price?
Shipping is worldwide. We will ask you to pay it separately closer to the date of the shipping on our website. Due to the coronavirus, the shipping prices are highly volatile right now, so we cannot accurately predict the exact delivery price. Even a few dollars of change can generate a massive risk for the project.
For now, we expect the prices to be 10-35$ depending on the shipping area. We are not making any money on it, and we will do our best to optimize the shipping process, so you get the lowest prices and fastest delivery times possible.
How about local taxes, duties, and VAT?
Our prices do not include local taxes, duties, and VAT. That will be subject to the laws and regulations of each individual country, but we will do our best to minimize the additional costs.
When will you ship?
We will receive the funds 14 days after the campaign ends, and then immediately kick off the tooling production. After that, we will run a few trial runs to be totally sure that the product is ready and reliable. If everything goes well, we’ll start shipping in February 2021.
Is this legal?
Official firmware will not have any kind of potentially illegal features, such as jamming, brute force, etc. So Flipper Zero should be completely legal in all countries. Since its open-source, you can always implement any feature you want or use 3rd party firmware made by the community. In this case, all responsibility is on you.
Will my Flipper have NFC and Bluetooth?
Yes, all the Flippers will have an NFC and Bluetooth. This does not depend on when you made your pledge.
How to choose the color? Can I add more Flippers to my pledge?
After the campaign ends, we will share a link to our Pledge Manager website. There you will be able to choose the color, confirm your address, choose add-ons, as well as change your pledge quantity. So keep an eye on your inbox.
I’m a noob, how can I learn to use Flipper?
We will make a wiki, the knowledge base, and how-to tutorials. This will help beginners to get familiar with Flipper features, coding, and electronics development. But it will be also very useful for experienced users and help them to dig deep inside Flipper’s brain — firmware architecture and electronics schematics.
Can I join the development?
Totally! We hope for your contribution from the very early stages. We are preparing the development program right now and will share it very soon in a future update.
Partners
For business inquiries please contact business@flipperzero.one
This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 1,100+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $460M raised between them.
More than $30,000,000 has been raised with Sprint's support
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Manufacturing & Supply Chain:

The founders of Flipper Devices Inc have been in the hardware business for more than 7 years now with 50+ products developed and manufactured (including crowdfunded projects). We have extensive experience in industrial and mechanical design development, manufacturing, testing, and shipping hardware products. We understand the production process well and know how to ensure that manufactured product is reliable, well tested, and delivered in time. 

We have a strong supply chain, our FATP factory in Shenzhen is greatly experienced in manufacturing electronic products with wireless-heavy features list, our mold factory is highly experienced in delivering high-quality plastic parts and our electronic components suppliers are solid and reliable.

Our manufacturing team is based in Shenzhen and will control and supervise every little step in the production process. However, the current situation in the world due to COVID 19 may still bring us unexpected issues, and if this happens we are committed to keeping you fully and transparently informed about how we’re going to deal with it and how it will affect the shipping dates.


Logistics:

Our logistics partners will fulfill the pledges with top-notch courier companies to ensure reliable and fast international direct-to-customer delivery. However, due to COVID 19, the shipping may be tricky nowadays with unexpected delays, problems on borders, and every day changing rules, possibly resulting in a few day's delay. We will be transparent and keep you fully updated if such issues arise.


Possible legal issues:

In some countries (not including the USA, Canada, UK, EU, and Australia), electronics like Flipper Zero might be in so called “grey” area and be subject to law regulations. We try out best to comply to all the major rules so Flipper can be used in as much countries as possible, but we still must ask you to keep this in mind and check with your local laws.

campaign.story:
A "Choose Your Own Path" Game that is Replayable! 
Eila and Something Shiny is a solo or cooperative board game with unique mechanics, providing you with a highly immersive and interactive story that is waiting for you to explore. At the same time, the game could still provide a LOT of replayability!
PLAY

The game comes with 5 chapters. In each chapter, you will first read the prologue comic booklet, which presents the background story and gives instructions on how to set up the game. Each chapter has its own card pool, special setting/rules, and game goal.
To progress, you will reveal event cards one by one from the card stand and make choices. You will gain, lose, or exchange resources from your choices. The decisions you make may also trigger new events that will occur immediately or at a later time.
When all the cards in the card stand are revealed, the "Night Phase" begins. You have to pay one energy token(or health point) to the time track as a time-counter. Shuffle the cards stored in the future zone and put them into the card stand. After that, another day begins.
 How to win? Game goals vary across chapters. In some chapters, you will need to gather a number of resources to win, while in other chapters, you will need to find the exit. Moreover, you will explore plenty of hidden goals that will also trigger a chapter’s ending!
Whenever you end a chapter with victory, you will read the corresponding ending comics to know more about how Eila goes through each stage. Reacting to your decisions, the story progress differently and will eventually lead to a different ending in chapter 5! 
 What will make me lose the game? Two ways: Either you lose all your health points, or there are 7 time-counters on the time track. There are plenty of negative events and enemies in this adventure that can harm you. Think twice before you make any decision as you will always bear the consequences of your own actions.
 You can save the game between chapters by simply putting aside the habit cards, item cards, and support cards acquired throughout your journey. When you start another chapter, those cards will assist you, or even alter the future.
 Some elements such as combats, riddles, and movements on the map will be introduced one by one starting from Chapter 2. You will read the additional rules before exploring a new chapter!

Two households, the Chauforts and the Cunningfields, both alike in dignity, in their fair kingdoms... if only there wasn't that ancient grudge...
 Ready... aim the catapults ... LAUNCH!  
Build your castle, set up your troops, and use your cunning tactics to conquer the floor!
Catapult Kingdoms is a game of last person standing. 
Your objective is to knock down all your opponent's troops!
Choose your side...
Build your castle...
Building a castle using only regular bricks! (prototype shown)
Make a Plan...
Choose your Weapon...
Fire at Will!!!
Catapult Kingdoms is language independent. The game's components have no text. As such, with just the rulebook you will be able to play the game in all supported languages.
Inside the game's box, the rulebook will be in English, French, Spanish and German.

Playing with more than 2 players is also possible with Catapult Kingdoms, but you will need the core game and at least the Siege Expansion (included with the Deluxe Edition). There are two ways to do this:
a) Team Play
If you are 4 players, you can divide into 2 teams of 2 players each. Each time a team takes a turn, you can have one player choose and play the Action Card and one player choose and fire the weapon.The next turn you switch roles. This makes the game even more fun because you can collaborate and come up with more elaborate castle designs and game strategies!
b) 3 or 4 players full support
To play a full game with 3 or 4 players you will need a second copy of the Core Game (if you also want to use the expansion you will need two copies of the Siege Expansion as well).
To play with 3 or 4 players, you set up like you see in the image below and apply the following rule: Every time a player is attacked (from any other player), they put the Distance Marker in front of their castle to mark the fact that they have already been attacked this round. NO other player can attack them as long as the marker is in front of their castle. At the beginning of the round, all Distance Markers are removed from in front of castles and returned back to their owners. If for any reason, when it is your time to use the weapon and you can not hit any other player (because everyone has a marker in front them), then you can draw two new Action Cards, keep one of them, and if you want you may immediately play a card (this means that you get to play two cards during your turn). 
Alternate Game Modes
In this game mode instead of each player building their own castle, you place the player boards in the middle of the floor and you build one big castle, placing all the troops in it (following all the Troop Placement rules).
After the castle is ready, each player gets their weapons and sits about 1 meter away from the castle. Starting with the youngest player, you take turns throwing everything you got at the castle trying to gain points (every brick you knock out is worth 1 point, every troop 3 points). 
Game  ends the moment last troop has fallen. You then calculate your points to find the winner!
At the beginning of the game, each player receives one Royal Base. Place the base on any one of your troops. From now on, this troop is part of the Royal family and has the following special ability: During your Tactics Phase, you may move your Royal to a new valid location (per the Troop Placement rules) on your player board. This is a free action, no action card required.
To make the game even more interesting, you can play the Defend the Royal variation. This adds an extra ability to your Royal: During the Tactics Phase, if you Royal is not in play (because it was removed in the previous round and placed in the box), you may retrieve it from the box and place them in a valid location (per the Troop Placement rules) on your player board. This effectively means that the Royal will be the last troop removed.

Risks and challenges
PLEASE READ THIS SECTION CAREFULLY BEFORE PLEDGING TO THIS CAMPAIGN.

PRODUCTION RISKS

Even though we do our best to ensure a quality product and a timely production, there is always the risk of delays. Supplier shortage, holiday traffic and weather conditions are just a few of the reasons a production could be delayed. Vesuvius Media Ltd should not be held responsible for delays caused by third parties. In addition, some of the items shown might differ from the final product due to supplier/manufacturer error.

MISSING/DAMAGED ITEMS

When dealing with a large number of orders, there is always a chance that errors will occur. If after you receive your order, you find that there are items missing, please contact us at support [at] vesuviusmedia.com and we will send you the missing items as soon as possible.

If your package arrives damaged, please take a few photos of all damaged items and email them to us at support [at] vesuviusmedia.com. We will send you replacements for the damaged items as soon as possible.

DELIVERY DATE

Our current estimation for delivery is November 2020. We want your orders to be delivered on time as much as you do; however, history has shown that despite the best laid plans there is always a chance of delay.

UNDELIVERED ITEMS

If a package is not delivered due to a backer's fault (wrong address given, backer didn't claim the delivered package from their post office, etc), the backer may be requested to pay additional shipping fees for the item to be sent out again.

BACKER RESPONSIBILITY

It is your responsibility to check the Kickstarter campaign's updates and the private messages we send you. If a backer does not complete the Pledge Manager in time, then the shipping rates to send you the game at a later time will be a lot higher (because they will not be part of the mass shipping process). If the game can not be delivered because you did not fill out your shipping information and more than 6 months have passed after the deadline, there is a chance we will not be able to deliver you the game. At that point, you will not be entitled to a refund.

DELIVERY ADDRESS

After this campaign, you will be requested to complete a survey through which you can let us know which items you have ordered as well as where you would like us to ship your order. Keep in mind that your order may be shipped sooner or later than the estimated delivery date. Please give us an address that will surely not change (If for example you think that you may be moving to a new house around May, please give us the address of a friend or relative to ensure a successful delivery).

SHIPPING

Please read the Shipping section above.

ORDER FULFILLMENT

Please note that your order may be delivered in multiple packages. This is done due to weight limitations for group shipments. Even though the items you ordered will be shipped at the same time, there is always a chance they will arrive to you several days apart. This may occur due to each country's postal service sort-and-dispatch system.

UPDATES

Through this campaign you may receive updates about Vesuvius Media's other upcoming projects. Such updates will be rare.

You will also receive notifications about future projects. These notification will also be very rare and it will be very easy for you to opt-out with on click.

BY PLACING A PLEDGE ON THIS CAMPAIGN, YOU ACKNOWLEDGE THAT YOU HAVE READ, UNDERSTAND AND ACCEPT THE RISKS & CHALLENGES STATED IN THIS SECTION.

campaign.story:
Full rules for Dice Miner's solo mode are also available for download, or you can watch producer Jeff Tidball walk you through a solo mode play-though:
"The drafting is quite fun!… The Beer dice symbols allow you to really set up the mountain." —Will Keeler, Roll for Crit
"As the turns go on, you amass more and more dice… What you’re thinking about and what your strategy might be for the long game is really going to progress as things go on." —Jonathan Estis, Roll for Crit 
“The ‘mountain’ dice tray is awesome!” —John G., Playtester
“Right up my alley. And I love dice!” —Ben M., Playtester
In the Dice Miner Kickstarter, everyone’s working together to earn Gems that unlock stretch goals. Backers vote on which goals to work toward next. 
Due to the overwhelming response to the Dice Miner campaign, every stretch goal we planned to offer — and some that we didn't plan — has been unlocked. There is always the temptation, when a campaign is exceeding expectations, to pile on more and more stretch goals. We've reached the limit of what we think we can responsibly deliver, so we're drawing a happy line under what's been unlocked and get to work delivering on our promises.
Thank you, backers!
The Dice Miner backer pack is a collection of components and extras delivered only to Kickstarter backers. The exact contents of the backer pack depend on which stretch goals are unlocked, as decided by you, the backers. 
When bonus tunnel dice are unlocked, the ones you get in your backer pack will depend on which version of the game you're getting. Standard backers will get Standard Edition bonus dice, Deluxe backers will get Deluxe Edition bonus dice. 
Bonus Goals
"Adventuring Party" Play Mode: If six new heroes are unlocked, the "Adventuring Party" play mode will also be automatically unlocked, and provided to all backers as a digital download. In this mode, each player gets three heroes per game, and uses a different one in each round. This bonus goal has been unlocked!
Liquid Courage Dice Game: If five tunnel dice are unlocked, a brand new dice game called Liquid Courage will also be automatically unlocked, and provided to all backers as a digital download. Created by our friends Sam Mitschke and Randy Scheunemann at Steve Jackson Games, we'll let Sam tell you more below. This bonus goal has been unlocked! 
My co-designer, Randy Scheunemann, and I set out to create a variety of dice games that offer interesting choices and give players some control over how the game plays out. Yes, even the randomness of dice games can include meaningful choices!
We spent months working with this goal in mind, we designed a ton of different games, and then we ultimately narrowed it all down to 26 that we feel are the best of the bunch. Those games are all featured in our book, Random Fun Generator — A Collection of Dice Games, which will be offered in an upcoming Kickstarter campaign from Steve Jackson Games.
One of those games, Liquid Courage, was designed specifically for Atlas Games, with the awesome custom dice from Dice Miner in mind, and we hope you enjoy it! 
— Sam Mitschke / Chief Creative Officer / Steve Jackson Games 
We'll alert Dice Miner backers about the Random Fun Generator Kickstarter when it goes  live, but you can also monitor dice.sjgames.com, where the book will feature prominently when it launches. We're extremely happy to feature Liquid Courage as a stretch goal for Dice Miner backers.
Liquid Courage is best played with six tunnel dice per player, but we're unlocking it with the fifth backer pack tunnel die because backers can still play it easily by using the 27 tunnel dice form their copies of Dice Miner. If more tunnel die are added to the backer pack after the fifth one, so much the better.

Basic

One Backer = 2 Gems
First-Day

One First-Day Backer = 5 Extra Gems*
* First-day Gem rewards are over and above the “basic gems” amount for dollars and backers.
Social Media
One New @AtlasGamesInsta Instagram Follower = 5 Gems
One New Atlas Games Facebook Page Like = 3 Gems
One New Atlas Games YouTube Subscriber = 3 Gems
One New @AtlasGames Twitter Follower = 2 Gem
  Challenges
 Stream a Dwarfbook Live Video (Go live on Facebook, tell us why you’re excited about dwarves, dice, or Dice Miner, and tag Atlas Games) = 50 Gems
 Mine for Dice on Instagram (Post an image on Instagram of dice you have discovered within or placed inside a hole of some kind, and tag #tabletop and @AtlasGamesInsta) = 35 Gems
 Subscribe to the Atlas Games mailing list for fans or retailers = 20 Gems
 Tweet Dwarves Love Dice (Tweet a photo including both a dwarf and a die, including a link to this Kickstarter and tagging @AtlasGames) = 25 Gems
 Cover Facebook in Glitter (Post a photo on Facebook showing off all your glittery dice, linking to this Kickstarter and tagging Atlas Games) = 20 Gems

You’ll pay later for shipping. You keep more of your money longer, and shipping rates will be as close as possible to actual cost. Trust us, we won’t make any money on shipping.
Rewards will ship from the Atlas Games warehouse in Duluth, Minnesota, USA. Based on our experience, this is more reliable and ultimately less expensive than a collection of global partners. In part due to our direct control of this facility, our shipping operations have remained both open and safe during the global pandemic.
You’ll prepay taxes later. (Group pledges are an exception— see below.) This allows rewards traveling outside the US to be sent “Delivery Duty Paid” (DDP) where available, so international packages shouldn’t be delayed at customs or flagged for extra fees. Backing Dice Miner on Kickstarter is not a useful way to avoid paying your local government’s taxes.
Here are the shipping, handling, and pre-paid taxes we anticipate by destination country. They are our best estimates, not guarantees.
For group pledge tiers, we will collect shipping and handling after the campaign. We will not charge for duties or taxes, nor pre-pay them, nor be involved in their administration or payment whatsoever. For group pledges, duties and taxes are the backer’s responsibility.
This campaign will not ship rewards to Afghanistan, Brazil, Congo, Ivory Coast, Eritrea, Guinea-Bissau, Haiti, Iran, Iraq, Liberia, Libya, Myanmar, North Korea, Russia, Somalia, Sudan, Syria, or Ukraine.
From the day we begin shipping, you’ll have a year to complete your order and pay for shipping and taxes. Pledges unclaimed after a year will be assumed abandoned.
Retail tier backers use Atlas Games’ standard direct-to-retail sales terms for shipping. See “Stones & Mortar,” below.
Add-ons will be available in the pledge management phase of the campaign. In addition to a variety of other Atlas Games titles, you’ll be able to add the following.
Punchboard Mountain — $8. Available to everyone, but intended mostly for Deluxe backers who would also like to have a punchboard mountain, in addition to a plastic mountain.
Deluxe Dice Set — $18. Available to everyone, but intended mostly for Standard backers who prefer the look of the punchboard mountain to the look of the plastic mountain, but who dig fancy dice. (We understand that a Standard Edition pledge plus a deluxe dice set costs about the same as a Deluxe Edition pledge. It reflects what the dice cost, and the fact that you wind up with 120 dice instead of only 60.) Includes a Deluxe Edition dice bag.
Standard Dice Set — $14. Available to everyone, added by popular demand. This is a full set of the sixty dice that come in the Standard Edition. Includes a Standard Edition dice bag.
Standard-to-Deluxe Upgrade — $18. Available to backers at the "Standard Group" pledge level only. Each of these add-ons upgrades one of the five Standard Edition games that are part of that pledge level to a Deluxe Edition game. This allows the two editions to be be mixed among a group of gamers who are backing together.
Josh DeBonis is the president of BumbleBear Games, where he designs arcade games. He lives in Brooklyn, NY, with his wife Amanda.
Nikola Risteski is French-born, residing in the US, managing IT by day, designing board games by night. He lives in Hoboken, NJ with his wife Siri and two kids, Anna and Kyle who are already Dice Miner Masters.
Dice Miner is Niko and Josh's second collaboration. Their first game together, Isle of Monsters, was released in 2017.
Jason has over a decade of professional experience designing and producing game components. He has a talent for blinking in photographs. 
Lil creates art for novel and narrative-driven games experiences. She enjoys deep conversations and unearthing the mysteries of a rotisserie chicken's skeleton.
Brigette is a full-time graphic designer and art director specializing in board game graphic design and logo design. Other roles include: theme party planner, extrovert, Star Trek enthusiast, and cat lover.
Co-owners of Atlas Games, John and Michelle have brought hundreds of exceptional card games, board games, and RPGs to fans around the world, over their 30+ years in the industry. Weirdly, their own kids prefer video games.
Greg is a veteran board game illustrator on projects like Conan, Star Trek, and Numenera. He became an artist so he could visit countless worlds without leaving his favorite chair. 
Jeff has designed, developed, or produced more than 50 board and card games. He is made of 85% Bert and 15% Ernie. 
Campaign ends: June 23, 2020
Pledge management launches: Early August, 2020
Regular pledge management ends: Early October, 2020
Backer shipments complete: End of November, 2020
Regular retail street date: January 15, 2021*
  These are our plans and best guesses. Our estimated delivery in January takes into account the fact that things sometimes go wrong.
* Retail backers may sell Dice Miner as soon as they receive their orders.
We believe that healthy retailers are key to a healthy hobby. We have a reputation for taking care of our retailer partners, and our Kickstarter campaigns are no exception. This campaign is retail-friendly because:
 The discount is what you expect. Your pledge gives you dollar-for-dollar credit to buy whatever mix of Standard and Deluxe Editions are right for your store, at our standard discount (50%) and regular shipping terms.
 The price is the price. Our campaign offers the standard edition at $29 (MSRP: $29.95) and the Deluxe Edition at $49 (MSRP: $49.95). Our Kickstarter does not undercut long-term sales.
 Exclusive Deluxe Edition access. The Deluxe Edition of Dice Miner will not be made available through distribution.
 You’ll get it before your competitors. Dice Miner’s channel street date is January 15, 2021, but if all goes according to plan (not guaranteed, but likely), you’ll receive your copies in early December and can sell them right away.
 Retail-only stretch goal. If 100 retail stores back Dice Miner, every one will receive a free demo copy of the Standard Edition. (As a point of reference, 124 retailers backed our last campaign.)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
At Atlas Games we’ve launched and delivered four Kickstarter campaigns, with our fifth currently in development and pending fulfillment. We invite you to visit the campaign pages for Feng Shui 2, Unknown Armies 3, Cogs and Commissars, Over the Edge 3, and Magical Kitties Save the Day to get a sense of how we deliver on our promises. We’d call your attention especially to the backer updates for Magical Kitties Save the Day, to give you a sense of how we handle things and what we do when the unexpected arises. Past our previous Kickstarters, Atlas Games has been publishing tabletop games and making good on our promises for 30 years.

As a game, Dice Miner is complete. Its rules have been extensively tested, its components have been modeled, the art is all finished (with the exception of any new art required by unlocked stretch goals), and the graphic design is nearly done. We expect that Dice Miner will go to press before this campaign is over.

At the same time: Yes, indeed, many things seem very uncertain these days. There are definitely risks that COVID-19 will disrupt our supply chain or affect our staff members. We promise that as challenges arise we will be transparent, plan sensible solutions, and keep you informed.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping Update: We Have the Games!
updates.update_content:
We Have the Games!
A truck containing the Dice Miner shipment arrived at our warehouse in Duluth, Minnesota this morning. We have photographic proof!

Ever Smart Making Good Time
Our tracking data suggests that the ship carrying our container of Dice Miner, the Ever Smart, is likely to arrive in Tacoma this afternoon. This is great news!
Keep in mind that there are often unexpected delays at port. We know that there will be some delays while the shipment is transloaded onto a truck for freighting to Minnesota. And of course, the trucking will also take time. But at this point, the number of left-field delays that might befall us continues to narrow the more legs of the journey we complete.
Pledge Manager Deadline

We Finally Kicked That Football
We got word from our freight forwarder that our May 8 sail date came true, and our container of Dice Miner is now en route from Shanghai.
Hooray!
What’s Next?

Not On the Water Yet
Our April 21 sailing didn’t succeed, but the strategies we discussed in our last update — meeting with our freight forwarder and expanding our list of possible entry ports — seem to be helping.
Routing the shipment to Tacoma seems like our best bet, so that’s the port we’re focusing on. Tacoma doesn’t have weeks worth of freighters backed up on the water waiting to unload, like Los Angeles does. Tacoma have pretty bad rail yard congestion at the moment, so it’s not without issues. But still.

April 4 Was a Bust
We learned last week that our booked sailing on April 4 failed. The next potential sail date we’ve received from our freight forwarder is April 21. This is terribly disappointing.
We're trying two new tactics, at this point, to increase the odds of successfully getting our games out of Shanghai:
We Are All Charlie Brown

No Steps Forward, One Step Back
As we reported in our last backer update, the Dice Miner shipment missed its first sailing date. Since then, our games have missed two additional sailing dates, the first on January 24, the second on February 7.
On top of that, we learned that contrary to our report in the last update, the Dice Miner shipment has not yet even been picked up from the factory. This makes some sense in retrospect. Since the factory is in relatively close proximity to the Shanghai port, if it’s known that a freighter booking has fallen apart, picking the games up from the factory only incurs the liability of additional storage fees until one of our bookings finally comes true, and does not even increase the chances of successfully making later bookings.

Shipping Update
The full shipment of Dice Miner games left the factory within a day or two of the December 22 departure date we estimated in our last update.
Our container is now (still) waiting at the port of Shanghai for its sail date. Why? Our freight forwarder advised us last week that our original booking was a “blank sailing.” This turns out to be a logistics term of art that describes a ship that plain didn’t show up where it was scheduled to be. If you’re interested in reading more, . (Universal Cargo is not our freight forwarder, but had the best explanation of a blank sailing on the first page of search results.)

Production Update
It has been a while since our last update, and although there is not very much that’s new or interesting to report, we’d like to keep you up to date.
Testing samples were produced and shipped to our contract lab on more or less the timeline we expected in our last update. The testing process alerted us to a few minor issues, but we were able to deal with them relatively easily, and without delaying the production process. (The process was not delayed because the testing process ran in parallel with the balance of bulk dice production, per our report in the last update.)

campaign.story:
My family,  runs a 5th generation homestead in Texas. I grew up in the back woods, and muddy creeks here in Texas, within walking distance of where I lived. Though my love for nature never diminished when I grew up, the areas I loved so much changed greatly. Trash would dam up the creeks I loved to fish, particularly, plastic bottles, they were everywhere. It was horrible seeing the land I loved turned into a dump by inconsiderate people.
I started cleaning up the area, but quickly realized this was not a sustainable method for me, I couldn't easily transport hundreds of trash bags through the bush, without them ripping open and all the contents going right back onto the ground. Then I remembered a trick I learned from my grandpa when I was a kid, was how you can take an old stump, and cut it in a way that it will hold a knife, and cut bottles and milk jugs into strips that he would use for different gardening tasks and jobs around the homestead. This allowed me to cut down the bottles and add them onto spools that i kept in the shed,  so not only was I able to clean the area up, but was able to turn it into a material we could use around the homestead ourselves, the only problem was they were so thick, and limited in their use because of that. This got me thinking as to how we could make the material the bottles created thinner, and more functional, as well as make a tool that can do it to fit into your pocket. This lead us, Grim Workshop  to create our cordage making tools, which processed bottles the same way, but are extremely compact, and portable. By doing this we realized not only did it make a functional material, while cleaning up one some of the most abundant waste product out there, but it would also give people incentive to pick up that waste, and turn it into something more than it was before.
From Conception, prototyping, manufacturing, and materials all components used in this campaign,  are all made and sourced in the U.S.A. Grim Workshop prides itself on the fact that we produce, and source all of our materials here in the U.S.A. helping support other small businesses along the way.
Our hope is that this campaign will help keep our creeks, and wilds more clean in places where people cant easily access to clean up, by providing such a functional material from the trash found in these locations. We hope this tool can help reduce plastic waste deposited into nature, and our landfills.
                    Plastic Rope Making Card
Our Plastic Rope Making card, also referred to simply as the "Cordage Card" is a credit card sized tool designed to turn wasted plastic bottles into a functional string that can be used for hundreds of tasks. This format is the easiest to use, as it is the largest version, it also fits inside a standard sized "Mint tin" as all of the Grim Workshop tools do, which is perfect for back packers and camping kits with extra tools, or to store some extra cordage you've made with it. The Cordage card also has a large hole for a carabiner attachment so you can hang it on the outside of a bag or attach it to other objects for easy use. The cordage card also comes with four holes, one in each corner so it can be secured to a flat surface and held still for additional ease of use.
Cordage Card

              Plastic Rope Making Dog Tag
The Plastic Rope Making Dog Tag, AKA the Cordage Tag was designed to be an even more compact version of our cordage card. This tool was designed to be dog tag sized, so it could be worn on a necklace, for easy access and use, or it could be attached to a key-ring, as a mid-sized design, it combines both functionality, and portability. Each Cordage Tag comes with a ball-chain connector, and a silencer to go around the outside of it.  
Cordage Dog Tag

            Plastic Rope Making Micro Tool
The Cordage Micro Tool was created to be the most compact tool of this sort that could be created. it gives you the ability to process bottles into cordage, and is smaller than a AAA battery. Combined with the convenient key-ring hole, and the metal clip included with it, and you've got an incredible tool, designed to go anywhere, and always be available.  Clip it to a backpack, or key-ring, and you've always got one at your fingertips. As this is the smallest possible design, it's also the most difficult to use.
Cordage Micro Tool
                       Cordage Tool Bundle
The cordage tool bundle, comes with all three of our cordage tools, that way you've always got one available, stash one at home in a camping pack, or survival kit, one on a key-chain, and one on a backpack zipper so you've always got one on hand. The Cordage tool bundle comes at special reduced pricing even lower than the already low kickstarter pricing per tool. 
Cordage Tool Bundle
                             Replaceable blades
The blades on these tools are all replaceable, if they ever wear out, one awesome feature of these, is the fact that many common pencil sharpeners actually use the same blade as we do! This means in a pinch, its really easy to find a new blade, or you can always purchase replacement blades from us at www.grimworkshop.com 
                 Incredible Strength and Versitility
After just a short period using this material, we found hundreds of different uses, but one of the things that impressed us the most, was how strong it was! How strong? One piece of the string from it could lift a cinderblock, one bottle could tow a ATV, and two bottles allowed us to tow an entire 3,000 lb Tractor! 
Towing a Tractor using two liter bottles
                          Reduce Plastic Waste
This new tool from Grim Workshop not only creates an amazing material useful for hundreds of tasks, but it also helps keep the earth a little cleaner, and gives people incentive to go pick up trash bottles, and do something more with them! you can reduce hundreds of bottles to a single spool, where otherwise it would take dozens of full trash bags. The perfect tool in our opinion gives you something, and gives back as well. 
                      Want Additional Rewards? 
You can easily add additional reward tiers, or items from our website www.grimworkshop.com to your pledge by adjusting your pledge amount to reflect these additional items you want. At the end of the campaign, there will be a section in your survey where you can list all additional items you pledged for. For more information on how to do this, use the instructions below, view them in the F.A.Q, or contact us for help! 
 For more incredibly unique tools like these 
Grim Workshop has created over a hundred unique tools like these, for everything from everyday, to camping, hiking, and more. for more tools as unique as these, come visit us at www.GrimWorkshop.com

campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Stainless steel construction, and replaceable blades means you'll be able to use this for years to come.
Reusability and recyclability
Grim utilizes reusable packaging wherever possible, and the entire basis of this tools existence helps keep waste out of the landfill.
Sustainable materials
Our tools are made almost entirely out of stainless steel, which is extremely durable, and long lasting. we also designed the tools in a way that you can replace the blades if/when they wear out, to ensure you'll be able to use it for years to come.
Environmentally friendly factories
Our manufacturing is all done here in the USA and adheres to strict environmental regulations.
Something else
Our tools entire design is around the idea of motivating people to pick up trash found all around the wild, and utilizing it by making this awesome rope from it.

campaign.story:
It's not too late. Click the image above to head to our website and pre-order the game.
PRE-ORDER LINK: https://buttonshygames.com/products/food-chain-island
On this forgotten island in a tiny corner of the ocean the animals are hungry! Your goal is to influence the wildlife - and arrange their meals - so there is only one animal left!
Food Chain Island is the next Button Shy Wallet Game, and the first in what we are calling our simply solo series. These are games that are one player only, light on rules, and big on replayability.  
Let's get into what makes Food Chain Island so awesome!
Start by shuffling the cards and making a 4X4 grid island of animals with the sea animals off to the side.  
On a turn, you must move one land animal one space in one of the four cardinal directions so it’s placed over another animal that is 1-3 numbers lower in value. In this way, you can move the ‘8’ animal over a 7, 6 or 5. 
When you do this, place the card on top of the lower card. This how an animal eats another animal.
When cards are stacked on one another, they are considered to be the number on the top. The stack of cards now moves as one.
When you move a card to eat another, you activate the ability on the card that just ate another. This special effect is mandatory and must be applied. In some cases, the ability will benefit you, and in others it will make the game harder.
The sea animals are there to help you out. At any time you may discard a sea animal and perform its special ability. Once a sea animal is used, it is discarded. 
The game ends when only one animal remains or if you are unable to eat an adjacent animal. 
If you only have one animal left, congratulations! You are an Ecological Expert.
If you have two animals left, nice job! You are an Accidental Matchmaker.
If you have three animals left, you just made it through! You are still an Island Intern. 
Otherwise, if you have 4+ animals, you have lost the game and need to keep trying.
Further Challenges
To make the game more difficult, randomly remove one or both of the sea animals. In addition, you can explore these alternate card layouts.
You can print and play the game today! The black and white version, along with unedited prototype rules is available at PNP Arcade.
LINK: https://www.pnparcade.com/products/food-chain-island-kickstarter-preview
For a complete playthrough, check out Matt Upton's video below: 
More to come as we update this image. :)
Also available here is Food Chain Island: Tough Skies, a three card expansion that will make your games just a little more challenging. At the beginning of the game, shuffle and place one card face-up into the play area. Do not use the others. During the game, you must activate, resolve and discard the air animal. The air animal must be resolved before the end of the game. For an additional challenge, use 2 or all 3 air animals.

Scott Almes is best known for the Tiny Epic series by Gamelyn Games. He's gone even bigger with Heroes of Land, Air and Sea and this time he's going even smaller. We first met in 2012 when Scott designed a game for our Storyteller Cards, and we've been looking for a chance to work together since.

campaign.story:
Escape Roll & Write
A game by Sebastian Schwarz for 2-4 players. Together as a team you must collect a certain number of gems, reach the exit and Escape, all before the temple collapses, and the game ends.
Each player explores their temple by entering chambers and gaining bonus actions and gems for the whole team. The special colored chambers require players to work together. They must occupy both chambers of the same color, in the same round to unlock two gems at once. A daunting task but worth it!
Players can select from different difficulty levels and variants to tailor the game to their group. Cooperation, communication, and a bit of luck rolling the dice is needed to gain the required number of gems and reach the exit before the time runs out.
The setup of the game is very easy. One adventure sheet is placed in the middle, and depending on the difficulty level, the goal on the gem track is marked. Each player takes a temple sheet, an adventurer, and a pen. A start player is determined and takes 8 dice. Then each player chooses a different direction from which they want to enter the temple. Done!
Game round
A round is played in clockwise direction beginning with the start player. The active player takes all uncursed dice, rolling them two at a time until all are rolled. After each roll they must decide if they want to keep the rolled symbols or place them in the common pool. But if a black mask is rolled, it is placed on the adventure sheet. These dice are cursed and locked from being rolled for three turns.
The active player's goal is to enter chambers on their temple sheet, collecting gems, and bonus actions. They can move their adventurer to adjacent chambers if they have the required symbols. In each chamber they gain the bonus depicted, which is then crossed out and transferred to the adventure sheet. 
Once the active player has used all their dice, or cannot use any more, the other players divide the dice in the common pool among them. With these dice they try to fulfill the treasure maps on their temple sheet. A treasure map is complete if they cross out all the required symbols, gaining a gem, and a bonus action for the whole team that is recorded on the adventure sheet.
The adventure sheet keeps track of the collected gems, game rounds, bonus actions (available and used), as well as locked dice (black masks). Available bonus actions (a box with a circle) can be used by the active player to move around their temple. If an action is used it is then crossed out. 
 Overview of the bonus actions: 
When players have collected the required number of gems, it is time to run for the exit in the center room of the temple. Everybody has to be in that chamber before the end of the final round in order to Escape!
Escape Roll & Write offers lots of replay-ability with various difficulty levels to tackle, and two different temple/adventure layouts to explore! 
The dice shrine chambers can be used with the Escape base game, offering additional challenges.  These chambers are exclusive to Queen Games.  They are available from this Kickstarter, and if there are any left in the production run, we will sell them at Fairs/Conventions, or via our webstore.  
To play with the new shrine chambers, 8 dice from the Roll & Write are required. Once a chamber is discovered two dice are rolled and placed on the shrines. Adventurers who enter the chamber can roll the needed icons to get either a gem, or one of 4 different special effects. The die is then removed to indicate it has been used. These chambers can also be played with any combination of expansions or Queenies.
Escape Queenie Box: 11 - 16
All Queenies that were released after the Escape Big Box 2nd Edition in one convenient box!
11 – The Cursed Gems
12 – The Slide
13 – The Map
14 – The Wishing Well
15 – New Quests
16 – New Traps
With this and the Big Box, players will have everything that is available for Escape. 
The Escape Queenie Box is also a great addition for players who only own the base game and want new modules to add to their adventures.
Queenie 11: The Cursed Gems is already included in the Big Box, but is such a popular Queenie that we wanted to include it for all players to enjoy.
Queenie 11: The Cursed Gems
Adventurers beware! You are in possession of a cursed gem and must find the matching gem inside the temple, or you cannot escape. You and your fellow adventurers must search the temple for matching gems and get rid of them. This Queenie adds another challenging layer and is, therefore, for experienced players.
Queenie 12: Slide
This Queenie comes with two chambers and a curse. The slide chamber is a tricky one, because you can enter it for free from the staircase side. But if you want to enter the chamber from the other side, you have to roll 3 torches. So you better be sure before using the slide too often.
The debris chamber is interesting since in order to discover this chamber a player not only has to roll two adventurer icons but also a key and a torch.
And finally, the Cyclops curse makes you cover one of your eyes with your hand and leave it there until the curse is lifted. Sounds easy, but rolling with one hand and moving your adventurer with limited vision is very tricky!
Queenie 13: Map
The map chamber is a great destination for players since it is one of the few chambers that actually help the players and make the escape a little bit easier. Inside the chamber a player can roll 2 torch icons and then place their adventurer in any chamber they want, allowing the player to quickly navigate the temple and help other players.
Queenie 14: Wishing Well
This chamber also helps the players succeed. If you roll 2 key icons, you may either draw a treasure, get rid of a curse, or regain one of your lost dice! And you can use the wishing well multiple times... But only one wish at a time, so you have to leave the chamber and reenter if you want to use it more than once
Queenie 15: New Quests
Now players must fulfill quests, which are special chambers, where they have to work together to overcome a challenge, otherwise they cannot escape. Each game players can decide if they want to tackle one, two or even three quest chambers.
Queenie 16: New Traps
Trap chambers are especially nasty since the adventurer must be placed inside the chamber upon discovery. Now they are trapped until they figure a way out or another adventurer helps them. There are 3 trap chambers in this Queenie. How many are you prepared to handle in your next game?
Add-Ons 
For backers who may have missed our recent campaigns or planned on getting the games at the Gen Con 2020 or Spiel 2020 (unfortunately neither of which will take place this year). We would like offer another opportunity to get Winter Kingdom here in this campaign, and Merlin Big Box, among others, in the pledge manager.
Pledging for this Campaign
Production for this campaign is planned for Q4  2020.  To ensure that shipping goes as smoothly as possible we are using Crowd Ox Pledge Manager.   
Escape Base Game
Escape: The Curse of the Temple is a real-time cooperative game in which all players must escape from a temple after awakening an ancient curse. The game plays in precisely 10 minutes, with an included soundtrack (also available digitally) counting down the game. Players must navigate through the temple by rolling dice and matching symbols to rooms, thereby gaining entry and visibility into adjacent rooms. The map of the temple will unfold as the players explore, making every game play different.  At certain points a countdown starts, and if players aren't back in the safe room when time is up, they will become "lost" and lose one of their dice. 
Big Box 2nd Edition
More content means more challenges to overcome. The Big Box includes the Base Game, 8 Expansion modules (originally released as three expansion boxes) and 10 Queenies (single expansion modules):
Module 1: Curses
Module 2: Treasures
Module 3: Illusion chambers
Module 4: Special chambers
Module 5: Quest chambers
Module 6: Characters
Module 7: Trap chambers
Module 8: Time chambers
Ten (10) Queenies. See the graphic for the names of each
Production and Delivery
The production of Escape Roll & Write as well as Escape Base Game and Escape Big Box 2nd Edition is planned for the end of October 2020. Our games are printed in Europe, so there is little delay between the end of printing and them arriving for fulfillment in our warehouse. Pledges to the US will most likely be sent via container to a fulfillment center. Please note that all shipping projections are our best estimates only, and not guarantees.
We offer "friendly" shipping to a number of zones around the world, including the United States, Canada, and the European Union. If your country is not listed as "friendly," Queen Games is not responsible for any local charges, customs fees, or if a local carrier (i.e. not the carrier we shipped by) loses your package. In these cases, we are not able to reimburse you for any charges.
Post Campaign Communication
We will monitor the comment section and messages while the campaign is active in order to answer everyone's questions. Please note that, since we do not have a full time employee dedicated to Kickstarter alone, we may not be able to actively monitor the comments after the campaign closes. If you have a question about your pledge, please send us a message.
We will do our best to post all pertinent information in a timely manner either as an update or in emails to relevant backers.
Terms and Conditions
By pledging for this product, you are accepting the following terms.
REFUND POLICY Following the terms of Kickstarter, Queen Games will provide a full refund provided the request is received within 14 days of the close of the campaign.If a request is made after this period, any refund would be at the discretion of Queen Games, and would be a maximum of 85% based on incurred fees and handling costs.
DAMAGED OR INCOMPLETE PRODUCTS We understand that all backers want to receive their items in pristine condition; however, the realities of worldwide shipping can sometimes make this difficult. We guarantee that the product you receive will be complete and all internal components in perfect condition. We will do our best to ensure that your package arrives in good condition, but all decisions on box replacements will be made on a case by case basis. Due to the difficulty and expense in replacing boxes, depending on your region, we will not be able to replace some boxes with minor cosmetic damage only.
RETURNED PRODUCTS If you refuse to accept your package on arrival we will not issue you a refund for the cost of the pledge.
FAILURE TO RESPOND TO SURVEY We will send a survey out to backers to collect addresses. If you fill out the survey after the designated time frame, your package may be delayed in sending to you by up to a months. If you do not fill out the survey until after the declared end of the project, we may not be able to send it to you.
REASONABLE CHANGES TO PRODUCT By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the name, final look, and materials of the project are subject to change and may differ from what is presented while the Kickstarter campaign was active. Queen Games will make all reasonable efforts to make the final product congruent with what is presented in the campaign, and to inform backers of the reasons for necessary changes.

campaign.story:
The dice in Tiny Ninjas: Heroes will be standard 16mm size and printed with a heat transfer process. A similar process to the dice in games like Too Many Bones or Star Wars: Destiny. They are incredibly resistant to wear! All the dice will be stored in a baggie to limit their movement during shipping. They have a stunning, lustrous pearl finish that makes them an absolute joy to play with!

Tiny Ninjas is a 1-2 player, dice-throwing, head-to-head card game. Learn to play in 5 minutes. Battles take roughly 10 minutes. Play right inside of the box!  Offering high-energy, fast-action fun for ages 8+. Because of its compact size and utilizing the box as the play surface it has an immensely small footprint. Play anywhere, play everywhere!
With 24 dynamic ninja characters, Tiny Ninjas has a thrilling blend of push-your-luck and hand management strategy. Battles are fresh, fast and filled with tense moments!
▶️ CLICK HERE FOR THE 2018 TINY NINJAS KICKSTARTER CAMPAIGN ◀️
Money pledged during the Kickstarter campaign will be used essentially as credit in the Pledge Manager after the campaign. So even at the PLEDGE MANAGER level those funds can be put towards upgrading to a game after the campaign!

Please note though that you will be charged for shipping in CAD through the pledge manager as we are Canadian and defaulted to use CAD currency.
LOCAL PICKUP - ALBERTA, CANADA - There will be a free pickup option available for backers located in Calgary, Red Deer or Edmonton. This will be handled in the Pledge Manager after the campaign ends. Pickup locations TBD. 
 Twitch, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, Kickstarter, Board Game Geek, Youtube

Risks and challenges
“Tiny Ninjas” was fulfilled on schedule back in Dec 2018 and I am more confident than ever to deliver another success with "Tiny Ninjas: Heroes". I have invested an enormous amount of time and energy to get to this point. That being said, the vast majority of work has already been completed.

The primary risks and challenges come from uncontrollable circumstances such as customs holdups, bad weather, or the current behemoth: COVID-19. I am following the situation very closely with my fulfillment partners and have allocated a large amount of buffer time for good measure. 

Communication is everything and I take a lot of pride in keeping backers updated throughout the entire process. I wouldn't have it any other way. 

-Ryan

campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Bullet♥︎ is printed with high quality materials and should last for as many games as you want to play it. We offer free replacement parts in the case of any damage or wear-out.
Sustainable materials
Bullet♥︎ is produced with only wooden and paper components, so the entire game will be recyclable and is created with sustainable materials.
Environmentally friendly factories
Our factory partner, BODA, is BSCI certificated. To produce Bullet♥︎ the factory uses renewable soybean ink. There are always leftovers after production. These used parts, such as wasted paper, printing ink, clearing water, and printing plates are recycled by a 3rd party after production is finished.
Sustainable Distribution
We're delivering to fulfillment centers around the world to minimize overland transport. By keeping the game box light and compact, we can reduce shipping costs and waste.

campaign.story:
#Growfromhome Movement is here! 
Pico will help you take your first steps into the magnificent world of growing plants. Easy and affordable, it ensures your plant journey is a success from the get-go. 

Know Your Pico  

As seen on 
Growing plants indoors around the year can be tough because they require lots of direct sunlight to thrive. Unfortunately, you can’t carry sunlight around to make sure your plants get the energy they deserve.
Thanks to Pico's multi-spectrum LED grow lights, giving your plant enough light isn’t a problem anymore; with it, you too can #GrowLikeaPro.
Powered by high-performance power-efficient LEDs from OSRAM, Pico provides all the necessary wavelengths of light to replace the sun completely, and allow you to grow plants all year round.
These powerful LEDs are chosen to support a wide range of plants and each color wavelength stimulates a specific biological function in plants.
 The LEDs are mounted on an easily-adjustable telescopic arm—because plants grow like crazy under our LEDs!      Reminiscent of a vintage radio antenna, it grows alongside your plants. As they extend upwards towards the light, extend Pico by up to a foot in height.
Power Pico through any USB Type-C cable. Included with your Pico are 2 cables to get you started, a short double-ended USB-C and a 3 meter (10’) super-long cable, along with magnetic organizer loops to help route the cable around fridges, windows or anything else magnetic. You may use any phone charger to power the Pico and the optional Pico-timer helps you automate it. 
The Aluminum heatsink makes the LED module rigid and lightweight; it also helps the LED chips last longer through its excellent heat dissipation.   
With its USB Type-C ports on both sides, you can chain up to 3 Picos together with a regular phone charger. Or build yourself an indoor jungle with 6 Picos powered through a 5V 3A charger! Just connect cables to either side, and each Pico will accept and pass-through power to the next one.

Regardless of how busy you are, Pico’s watering system makes sure your plants have as much water as they need—no more, no less—to sustain their health and beauty. All you need to do is top-up once a week. 
Watering too little can kill your plants, but so can too much. Getting it right takes time and experience. Not many of us have it. With Pico, that’s all taken care of for you!
The transparent window lets you know when it’s time to top up, typically once a week. Employing just capillary action and gravity, this design does not require any power supply or involve a motor or pumps. Your plants will also grow quicker and healthier due to root oxygenation from below, provided by the ventilation holes.
Plant pots take up space. They often can only be placed on flat surfaces by windows, which limits your options.
 With Pico, any place is a good place to grow some plants.
Work desk? Check. Fridge? Check. Wall? Check. Glass window, bathroom or even in a vehicle? Check, Check, Check. 
All 3 interchangeable mounts are included with your Pico.
Why several mounts?  Because when it comes to plants, you can't have too many and you might want them everywhere.

Anywhere is a good place to grow!
Grow anything you like 
No seed pods or subscription is involved and hence no recurring costs! Choose any seeds or growing medium of your choice.

Plants Make You Happy
Research has long suggested that indoor plants have a positive effect on the human mind and body. Studies show up to 60% reduction in depression, over 40% in anger, and just under 40% in anxiety. And at work, plants have increased the productivity of the office by up to 15%!
Plants have been proven to improve motivation and concentration, increase energy levels and decrease fatigue. And thanks to the transpiration and evaporation of water from plants, they increase the air quality and improve eye strain and skin health, and reduce the spread of airborne diseases.


Fresh Herbs Right In Your Kitchen 
Always wanted to have fresh edibles at hand? Imagine being able to throw your own homegrown, organic basil onto that bowl of pasta, or some fresh mint on your chicken. 
No more runs to the store for that missing ingredient, having to wash the pesticides and chemicals off of your leafy greens.
Growing edible plants can be a challenge. And while the end result is often worth it, it is a commitment most people find difficult to make. With Pico, we made sure to get all variables just right, so you can grow your favorite herbs at home without a hassle.

Yes, it's tough choosing a color.


 Stretch Goals unlocked!!
 Pico tool design credits to Daksh Savla

What’s Included
Pico comes assembled and ready to grow. Just take it out of the box, add some soil and water, and a few of your favorite seeds. Plug it in and watch your plants thrive!   
 What’s in the box
 1X Pico (preassembled and ready to use)
 1X Power cable (with magnetic cable organizer) (1 meter - 3' 3'')
 1X Daisy Chain Cable (3 meters - 9' 10'')
 3X Interchangeable mounts (magnetic, velcro, wall mount)

Who we are?
 We're Altifarm Enverde, a startup based across the USA and India. We strive to offer a healthier and wholesome way of life to all. We believe in Your Right to Grow, Anywhere, Anytime.
Our design team behind Pico
 Our first campaign was for Altifarm, which led us to switch from a Product Design studio into building home farming products. Altifarm is our flagship home farm with grow lights, greenhouse and mobility packs.
 Last year we launched Herbstation, a more sophisticated compact indoor farm. We've just completed fulfilment to our Kickstarter backers around the world.
Compared to the other two, Pico is a tiny—but only in size and not in ambition. Our goal with Pico is certainly big—to bring as many people as possible into the fold of Urban Farming. Now anyone can connect with nature and #GrowlikeaPro!
This year, we took Pico to CES 2020. We were excited by all the attention—no one could get enough of it!  

 Why Grow at home?  
Is it possible for a Pico to grow enough to replace grocery shopping? Certainly not! 
With our products Altifarm and Herbstation, we help people grow a substantial amount of fresh produce at home, with soil-based and soil-less methods. If anything, most items that are consumed fresh—the ingredients for salads, smoothies, soup, garnish—Altifarmers grow enough to meet a family's requirements when planned and rotated well
With Pico, our aim is to bring up the conversation around sustainable practices in food, and by participation, to have a greater appreciation for fresh produce among family members, including children. 
You don't need fertilizers or pesticides when you grow your food at home—no transportation, refrigeration, or even washing is required. And certainly, no single-use plastic packaging is involved.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We just concluded fulfillment for our Herbstation preorders to over 35 countries. We had our share of delays, mixups, and drama. The journey of a product from an idea to a product is a shelf, is arduous and challenging. This being our third global product launch we are even better learned and prepared.

Although Pico is production-ready with all tooling and manufacturing processes in place, we cannot ignore the elephant in the room - the COVID-19 crisis. While we do not have any external dependency on China or other markets and the entire product is manufactured in close vicinity, we have uncertainties staring at us. Once we are out of the stay at home deadlines, we would resume first batch production and get the early birds ready for shipment.

If there are any delays or roadblocks down the road, we assure you transparent and regular updates.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
